items.headline: Investors have reasons to be nervous about markets right now. How to separate the warning signs from the noise.
items.summary_en: Throughout all the market choppiness, stocks pushed higher this past week.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘I’m stumped’: I put $3,000 on my credit card during a vacation and my credit score plunged. Why is it so volatile?
items.summary_en: “Doesn’t a 30-year history of good credit count for anything?”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘My family is having a crisis’: My mom added my brother to her mortgage. He stopped paying. How does she get him off it?
items.summary_en: “He refuses to take their names off the mortgage without getting paid.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: I’m 77. Despite my $1.4 million wealth, my expenses exceed my income. Do I sell stocks to pay off my mortgage?
items.summary_en: “I started my own tax-preparation and representation firm. My annual revenue is $60,000 before taxes.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: There’s one key piece of chart evidence missing to call for a stock-market correction
items.summary_en: Despite concerns that a stock-market correction is imminent, repeating patterns of success by bulls show the uptrend is still intact — for now.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘It’s getting scary close to retirement’: We’re 70. We have no debt, no stocks and $275K in savings. Are we in trouble?
items.summary_en: “We will have $4,300 a month in Social Security.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘She may have a spending problem’: Would it be wrong to secretly give our son money — without telling his wife?
items.summary_en: “Our son and his wife, who are in their 30s with a child in preschool, are having marital problems.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: I’m 42, a single parent with $372K in cash and CDs. I won’t invest in stocks. Am I wrong?
items.summary_en: “I am not comfortable putting too much cash in stocks, especially given I have two young kids.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘I can’t stop thinking about money’: I’m struggling with guilt over my $135K in financial mistakes. How do I move on?
items.summary_en: “We aren’t in debt outside of our mortgage, but I feel sick when I think about the money.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘I have no retirement savings’: My wife and I are in our 40s. She has an $85K Roth IRA. Is it too late for me?
items.summary_en: “Historically, we’ve been keeping the contribution to her Roth at $50-$200 a month.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.
